ComicInfo.Notes: Tagged with comicbox 1.1.1 on 2024-03-13T20:57:31 [Issue ID 4000-161086] urn:comicvine:4000-161086 Tagged with ComicTagger 1.6.0a13.dev122 using info from Grand Comics Database on 2024-06-18 03:43:15. [Issue ID 348866]
ComicInfo.Summary: Whether cursed by fate, stupidity, or genetics, THE BIG BOOK OF LOSERS tells the tales of real people who were forced to endure a damned existence. Exploring the unfortunate adventures of those who could not catch a break, this amazing reference book documents the stories of people who have lost in life, sports, business, and politics. From President Garfield, who died after several incompetent doctors turned a small bullet wound into a huge, festering malady to the woman who burned her husband's life savings in the oven, this tome shows that some people are just destined to come out on the bottom. Also included in this book are the most legendary loser products such as New Coke, the female urinal, and the paper dress.
ComicInfo.Title: Adam; Can't Win for Losing; Sore Losers; Wrong Place, Wrong Time!; Losers Weepers; Get a Life; Sore Sports Losers; The Golden Hill; Yousouf Ishmaelo; Pavel Navrotsky's Pig Pen; Old Losers Never Die; Presidential Also-Rans; Harold Stassen; William Henry Harrison; James Garfield: Martyr to Medicine; Thomas Paine; The Hunt Brothers; Leon Trotsky; Rudolf Hess: Uberloser; Yukio Mishima; Lunchtime for Victor Biaka-Bod; Croesus; Montezuma; The Edsel; The Picturephone; New Coke; The Paper Dress; Cars of Future Past; Women's Urinals; Movie Gimmicks Time Forgot; Smokeless Smokes; Susan B. Anthony's Dollar; Fallout Shelters; Meet: Milli Vanilli; Spade Cooley: King of Western Swing; Frankie Lymon; The Cherry Sisters; From Moondog to Scapegoat; Carrie: The Musical; Joe Meek's Musical Rocket Science; The Crash of '29; George Armstrong Custer; Dead Letters: The First Airmail Flight; The Dalton Gang's Last Raid; The FBI Raid on Little Bohemia; Technocracy: Better Living Through Technology; The Maginot Line; Watergate; Nicholas Leeson Loses His Barings; Patently Ridiculous; Edwin Armstrong: Father of FM Radio; Edison's Cement Housing; Nicholas Cugnot; Dr. James Graham; The Pneumatic Subway; Mark Twain: Investor; Howard Hughes and the Spruce Goose; Elisha Gray: The Real Inventor of the Telephone!; Ulrich Von Lichtenstein: What a Knight!; Fletcher Christian and the Bounty Mutineers; Thomas Nuttall: Lost Explorer; Captain Fonck; Clem Sohn; Tom Gurr, Salvage King; Richard Haselton; Sors Hariezon; Daniel K. Ludwig; Bob Ford; The Gatti Gang: Italy's Least Wanted; Francis Gary Powers; Anna Edson Taylor; Captain Kidd
